examples: What is the domain of sine of the sine function?
Because the x-y plane here is our domain.
So what is the domain of the sine function?
We call it Domain.
It's the domain.
words.defineEn: a geographic area that is under the control or influence of a particular entity, such as a nation, ruler, or organization
words.defineVi: một khu vực địa lý nằm dưới sự kiểm soát hoặc ảnh hưởng của một thực thể cụ thể, chẳng hạn như một quốc gia, người cai trị hoặc tổ chức

examples: The lion's roar can be heard from miles away, establishing its dominance.
Our dominance over planet Earth really begins here.
The dominance of the human species over planet Earth really started here.
Trump's dominance would culminate in front of the cameras in the Rose Garden.
This contract would have solidified Bezos's dominance in cloud computing.
words.defineEn: the state that exists when one person or group has power over another
words.defineVi: trạng thái tồn tại khi một người hoặc một nhóm có quyền lực đối với người khác

examples: The company struggled on through some dark days several years ago, but it has since established itself as a dominant force in the market.
Stevenson used to be the dominant player on the tour, but it looks like she has finally found her match in the young newcomer.
Cash transactions are still dominant.
Definitely my left eye is dominant.
Then, around 1900, the H1-type virus became dominant.
words.defineEn: having superiority in power, influence, or importance
words.defineVi: có ưu thế về sức mạnh, ảnh hưởng, hoặc tầm quan trọng

examples: The other team came out and dominated our players like nobody's business.
The fact that the Champions League is increasingly dominated by English clubs just rubs salt into his wounds.
The team won the championship with flying colors - they dominated the competition and didn't lose a single game.
The celebrity scandal dominated the headlines for a short period, but it turned out to be just a nine-day wonder as people quickly forgot about it and focused on other news.
In the cutthroat world of business, it's often said that big fish eat little fish, and that the most successful companies are those that can outcompete and dominate their rivals.
The appointment of a woman was one in the eye for male domination.
Domination was very much the idea.
Its courts, religious law, local priests, and a huge bureaucracy of religious officials enforced its domination.
Domination was on Jeff's mind from the beginning.
But Viagra's domination of the E.D. market always had an expiration date.
words.defineVi: sức mạnh để thống trị hoặc đánh bại

examples: The article portrayed her as domineering by dropping quotes from her out of context.
This is where the parent becomes domineering and controlling.
words.defineEn: rule or exercise power over (somebody) in a cruel and autocratic manner
words.defineVi: cai trị hoặc thực thi quyền lực đối với (ai đó) một cách độc ác và độc đoán

examples: Browder claims a 60 percent success rate, and has expanded Do Not Pay to the U.S. and to other legal imbroglios.
words.defineVi: một sự hiểu lầm rất đáng xấu hổ

examples: Local citizens imbue the map with meaning, like which of these buildings are houses, or where there are important community gathering places, hospitals, and businesses.
Flags were meant to imbue colonial conquerors with the authority of the monarchs sponsoring their voyages.
Rivera once referred to Kahlo's paintings as "unconventional retablos imbued with a monumental realism."
This imbues us with an absolute moral worth, Kant said, which means that we shouldn’t be manipulated, or manipulate other autonomous agents for our own benefit.
Toyota is hoping it can imbue its vehicles with passion and excitement while preserving the legacy of high quality and affordability.
Well, I have the luxury of cleaning the bore to an immaculate state, which helps with accuracy in an actual war situation.
And this combination of aspirational impulses and the urge to restore life to some immaculate past does strike me as very American.
words.defineEn: free from any stain or dirt
words.defineVi: không có bất kỳ vết bẩn hoặc bụi bẩn

examples: And in turn, these inhabitants determine how the biome looks, called its physiognomy.
words.defineEn: the human face (`kisser' and `smiler' and `mug' are informal terms for `face' and `phiz' is British)
words.defineVi: khuôn mặt con người (`kisser' và `smiler' và `mug' là những thuật ngữ không chính thức cho `face' và `phiz' là tiếng Anh)

words.defineEn: the study of physical features of the earth's surface
words.defineVi: nghiên cứu các đặc điểm vật lý của bề mặt trái đất

examples: Similarly, behavior is constrained by an animal's physiology.
Their wings were a brand new innovation in their physiology.
What ultimately separates lucid dreams from regular old REM sleep may lie in the physiology of the brain.
Anatomy is all about what your body is, physiology is about what it does.
You want to talk physiology?
words.defineEn: the field of science that studies the function or interactions among organisms
words.defineVi: lĩnh vực khoa học nghiên cứu chức năng hoặc tương tác giữa các sinh vật

examples: Hot beverages stimulate sweating.
The voltage from our musical signal is stimulating our cockroach leg.
Interracial anger is stimulated.
Instead, the current was stimulating the angular gyrus, which blends vision with body sense.
And reflex arcs stimulate some muscles, while inhibiting others.
words.defineEn: cause to do; cause to act in a specified manner
words.defineVi: nguyên nhân để làm; nguyên nhân để hành động theo một cách cụ thể

examples: More stimulus is needed.
We passed the stimulus.
The big rock for now in our rucksack is a stimulus deal.
Just a tiny stimulus can set the sundew in motion.
The stimulus didn’t really get anywhere.
words.defineEn: something that encourages an activity or causes a reaction in a person or thing
words.defineVi: cái gì đó khuyến khích một hoạt động hoặc gây ra phản ứng trong một người hoặc vật

examples: The island derives its name from its Easter day discovery by the Dutch explorer Jacob Roggeveen in 1722.
Many English words were derived through metathesis.
They can derive information, like its mass and the shape of its orbit.
And we can derive a model for this gravitational potential energy.
Unfortunately, presidents don’t derive their powers from the sun, like Superman.
words.defineEn: reason by deduction; establish by deduction
words.defineVi: suy luận bằng suy diễn; thiết lập bằng cách khấu trừ

examples: So the derivative probably has a bit of a maximum point there or something.
The derivative is the slope.
But derivative is a big part of it.
Derivative of sine is cosine, and vice versa.
So what is the derivative?
words.defineEn: formed from an idea that is a slight or full copy of something else
words.defineVi: được hình thành từ một ý tưởng là một bản sao nhỏ hoặc đầy đủ của một cái gì đó khác

examples: And you should look up this derivation.
But if you're super curious, I'll do the derivation at the end of this video.
I'm not going to do the derivation here, even though it would have been awesome.
And its derivation will be actually quite similar to the one for springs and swings and things that are oscillating, which shows up a lot in physics.
The French Revolution asked new questions about the nature of people’s rights and the derivation of those rights.
words.defineEn: the source or origin from which something derives (i.e. comes or issues)
words.defineVi: nguồn hoặc nguồn gốc mà từ đó một cái gì đó bắt nguồn (tức là đến hoặc vấn đề)

words.defineEn: characterized by inflections indicating a semantic relation between a word and its base
words.defineVi: được đặc trưng bởi các biến thể chỉ ra mối quan hệ ngữ nghĩa giữa một từ và cơ sở của nó
